channel.title: 317 Client installer HELP [PI]
channel.description:
[b]I am using the Project Insanity base server[/b]
Since I have recently managed to both host and edit my own server, I am now looking for a way to create my own webclient and a client installer.
I followed two webclient tutorials on this forum without any luck and I've also followed a 317 installer tutorial :(
[b]Regarding the installer: I also want the files to be sort of un-editable and only to be read by the client application, meaning I don't want the installer to be like a winRAR archive just copying all the .java and .class files.[/b]
I was hoping you guys could help me, and every piece of advice is highly appreciated :cool:

item.title: 317 Client installer HELP [PI]
item.dc:creator: @benny679 benny679
item.description:
@benny679 wrote:

Sorry for the late response. I don’t have a lot of time to make it. Go to rs-ps.org and make on, then download the html

Read full topic

item.title: 317 Client installer HELP [PI]
item.dc:creator: @i_lex_50_i i lex 50 i
item.description:
@i_lex_50_i wrote:

[quote=“rawr i am scary, post:2, topic:352052”]An installer? How about an auto install.

The only thing they’d have access to is the cache, which if they can’t leech a real client or make a new one, they can’t make much use of it.

Also they can’t access the actual .java files unless they know the link to the jar and how to extract it. Which most don’t.[/quote]

Well that certainly looks interesting. but I think I’m gonna need a tutorial, last time the .jar to .exe didnt work (the .exe didn’t do anything)

benny679:

I can make you a webclient.

Really? What do I need to do?

Read full topic

item.title: 317 Client installer HELP [PI]
item.dc:creator: @benny679 benny679
item.description:
@benny679 wrote:

I can make you a webclient.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 Client installer HELP [PI]
item.dc:creator: @rawr_i_am_scary rawr i am scary
item.description:
@rawr_i_am_scary wrote:

An installer? How about an auto install.

The only thing they’d have access to is the cache, which if they can’t leech a real client or make a new one, they can’t make much use of it.

Also they can’t access the actual .java files unless they know the link to the jar and how to extract it. Which most don’t.

Read full topic

item.description:
@i_lex_50_i wrote:

I am using the Project Insanity base server

Since I have recently managed to both host and edit my own server, I am now looking for a way to create my own webclient and a client installer.

I followed two webclient tutorials on this forum without any luck and I’ve also followed a 317 installer tutorial

Regarding the installer: I also want the files to be sort of un-editable and only to be read by the client application, meaning I don’t want the installer to be like a winRAR archive just copying all the .java and .class files.

I was hoping you guys could help me, and every piece of advice is highly appreciated
